column3: EFFECT
column9: EFFECT

column3: You can take Woundscale damage in place of an adjacent ally or by expending SEELE equal to the distance between an ally and yourself.
column9: When you are targeted by an attack, you may pay 2 SEELE to to convert one of your Weapon attack die into EVADE dice.

column3: For some reason, you no longer age. Unnatural effects that would alter your age are ineffective. You can still be killed in much the same manner that anyone else can be killed.
column9: Rapidly change your position, leaving afterimages behind. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a bonus to your Evasion equal to your Footwork and the first attack that misses you causes the attacker to be off-balance until their next turn, giving them a penalty to their BODY skills equal to your Footwork.

column3: Declare a Language when taking this Feat. You may treat one failure as a normal success when casting this Language.
column9: Deliver a kick charged with radiant energy. This attack ignores half of the target's Protection and blinds them until the end of their next turn on a successful hit.

column3: Add 1D to any Social Engineering or Intimidation skill.
column9: After making an attack, instantly disengage and move away. After resolving your attack, you can immediately move up to your full movement speed without provoking reaction attacks.

column3: You and everyone within your presence can reroll one Trial per rest period.
column9: Unleash a dazzling series of kicks that confuse your opponent. Make three unarmed attacks against a single target. For each hit, the target's Protection is reduced by 1 until the start of your next turn.

column3: You emanate terror. Upon entering your presence, all must pass a Nerve Trial.
column9: Your movements become a blur of rapid strikes. Make a number of unarmed attacks equal to your Acrobatics skill level. You can move up to 2 meters between each attack without provoking reaction attacks.

column3: You're evil and everyone can tell. You and all cohorts within your Presence gain 2D to Intimidate or Social Engineering. Characters helping you with Intimidate or Social Engineering confer an additional die for each instance of help.
column9: Create an illusory double that distracts your opponent. Make a feint as a free action before your attack, rolling your Savoir Faire vs Composure. If successful, your next attack deals additional damage equal to your Acrobatics skill level.

column3: Your weapons gain the Disabling effect on a successful attack.
column9: Become a whirlwind of kicks and strikes. For the next three rounds, you can make an additional unarmed attack as a free action each time you move at least 3 meters.

column3: You have learned gruesome techniques for spellcasting involving your own blood. When you cast a spell, you may add dice equal to the most recent Wound you have taken. This ability cannot be reused until you take another Wound.
column9: Move with blinding speed. You can move up to double your normal movement speed as a free action and make an unarmed attack at the end of this movement. This movement doesn't provoke reaction attacks.

column3: You automatically track creatures that have taken Woundscale damage in the last hour. They cannot skulk from you nor apply Silent weapon damage.
column9: Your next melee attack can hit multiple enemies within range.

column3: Gain extra movement equal to your highest Body Stat.
column9: When you are engaged in a Melee exchange, you may activate this ability to rearrange your attack and evade dice order for 1 Seele per rearranged die.

column3: You ignore fall damage from distances up to Movement + Acrobatics meters. You may Parkour, ignoring unit collision when calculating movement.
column9: Once per Combat Encounter, you may activate this Maneuver to render yourself untargetable until your next turn.

column3: Command nearby natural beasts as a free action. Non-hostile creatures with MIND stats lower than your pips will automatically obey. You may attempt to dissuade or dominate hostile creatures.
column9: Upon successfully counterspelling, you may attempt to hijack the spell you have counterspelled. Roll your Arcane skill against the Trial value of the spell; succeeding allows you to immediately cast the spell, failing incurs the same penalties that the opposed caster would have suffered.

column3: You may force rerolls on attacks against you and nearby allies a number of times equal to your Artistry pips.
column9: Expend a point of SEELE to use two items when you take the USE ITEM action. Alternatively, you may go into Action Defecit to take an additional USE ITEM action this turn.

column3: Over the course of a combat encounter, you may grant any number of dice up to your Arts skill to assist any target's roll in an attempt to do something performative.
column9: Your next ranged attack may hit the same enemy twice or two separate enemies.

column3: Use an action to analyze enemy tactics, granting allies a 1d reroll against similar enemies for rounds equal to your pips.
column9: Your next ranged attack deals additional Woundscale damage equal to the Seele expended on this attack.

column3: You may ignore calculations of vertical distance once per movement action.
column9: When you take the DEFEND action, you may expend additional SEELE to gain an additional EVADE die for every 2 expended SEELE.

column3: Use deception to create an opening, granting a reroll on your next attack roll plus bonus damage equal to your Bluff pips.
column9: When you are targeted by an attack, gain 1D to your EVADE for every 3 SEELE you spend.

column3: At the start of a combat encounter, gain bonus SEELE for the party equal to half of your Business pips.
column9: Fire an arrow infused with spiritual energy that ignores range penalties. This attack can be made at any distance you can see, ignores cover bonuses, and deals additional damage equal to your highest SPIRIT stat.

column3: You start the combat encounter with one stack of Stability.
column9: For the next minute, you can draw and nock arrows as a free action, allowing you to make an additional attack with each Action Point spent on attacking.

column3: You ignore unit collision and always fit through any spaces in terrain. You receive benefits from cover as if they were one degree higher.
column9: Fire an arrow that travels silently through the air. This attack doesn't break stealth and ignores Evasion against unaware targets. If it hits, it deals additional damage equal to your Stealth skill level.

column3: Spend 1 SEELE to quickly repair or modify equipment, adding your Crafting pips to its effectiveness for the encounter.
column9: For one round, you enter a state of hyperfocus. You can make a ranged attack as a free action after any other action you take this round.

column3: You may reroll your initiative at the start of each round. Add your Edge to your initiative rolls.
column9: Loose a rapid series of arrows. Make a number of attacks equal to half your Ranged Mastery skill level (rounded up) against a single target or multiple targets within range.

column3: Protection die you roll can now be used to negate critical hits.
column9: Unleash a devastating barrage of arrows into the air that rain down on your enemies. Make a single attack roll against all enemies in a 10-meter radius area within your weapon's maximum range. Each target takes damage and must make a Footwork check or be pinned down until the end of their next turn.

column3: Quickly analyze and exploit structural weaknesses, adding Engineering pips to damage against constructs and structures.
column9: Fire an arrow that can bounce off surfaces or even thin air. You can hit targets behind full cover or around corners. The arrow can ricochet up to three times before striking its final target.

column3: You gain additional dice to your Dodge rolls equal to your Footwork that you may expend over the course of the combat encounter.
column9: Combine a defensive maneuver with a counterattack. As a reaction to being targeted by a melee attack, you can move up to half your movement speed without provoking reaction attacks and make a ranged attack against your attacker.

column3: Gain an additional 1D to all attack rolls made against enemies you have previously vanquished.
column9: You intercept an incoming attack on behalf of someone within your MOVE.

column3: Expend 1 SEELE to cleanse a Bane or Affliction on yourself.
column9: Build up energy through a series of movements before releasing it in a powerful strike. If you move at least 5 meters before this attack, double the bonus damage from your highest MIND stat for this strike.

column3: You can see in nonmagical darkness and can add your Hypersense to your SEEK rolls.
column9: Align your body's energy with incoming attacks to deflect them. Until your next turn, add your highest MIND stat to your Defense against melee and ranged attacks.

column3: At the start of combat, predict one enemy type's weakest defense, dividing your Insight pips to attacks targeting those enemy types.
column9: Move with the grace and unpredictability of a complex melody. For one round, your movement doesn't provoke reaction attacks, and you can move through enemy-occupied spaces.

column3: You may reroll 1s a number of times equal to your Instinct in the next combat encounter.
column9: Enter a state of heightened awareness. Until your next turn, you can make an immediate counter-attack against any enemy that misses you with a melee attack.

column3: You ignore action point costs when activating devices/traps.
column9: Achieve perfect balance between mind and body. For the next three rounds, you can use your highest MIND stat instead of BODY stats for any related checks.

column3: Use an action to frighten enemies within sight, reducing their initiative by your Intimidation pips.
column9: On a successful hit, the target takes additional damage equal to your Arcana  skill level and must make a Composure check or be stunned for one round.

column3: You may use a full turn of actions in order to fabricate a Limited 1 combat gadget with effects based on available materials and your pips in this skill.
column8: Kai Tenn: Stance of the Unbroken Rhythm
column9: Adopt a flowing stance that aligns your movements with the cosmic rhythm. For the next three rounds, you may add your Arcana on all Acrobatics and Melee Mastery rolls.

column3: You ignore the action point cost to fetch/stow and use items on your person.
column9: Target specific pressure points with rapid, precise strikes. Make three attacks against the same target. If all three hit, the target must make a difficult Endurance check or be paralyzed for one round.

column3: Analyze battlefield patterns to predict enemy movements, adding Logic pips to allies' tactical rolls.
column9: When you take a Mortal Wound or would be Downed, immediately take a full turn with +2D and then fall unconscious. You cannot be raised or healed until the end of the Combat Encounter.

column3: Calculate trajectories to enhance ranged attacks, adding Mathematics pips to hit rolls with thrown or projected weapons.
column9: Expend one Seele to increase your jumping distance by a number of meters equal to the sum of your highest BODY stat/Attribute plus your Tiers in Acrobatics and Athletics.

column3: You ignore action limit for the HEAL action in combat.
column9: When you are targeted by an attack, you may pay SEELE equal to the incoming attack dice to activate this ability. Roll an opposed attack. Prevent the incoming attack if you succeed.

column3: As an Action, you may issue a command to an ally. They are obligated to obey this command and carry them out as free actions.
column9: You may attempt to throw any object smaller than 10kg as a distraction. You may use your Ranged or Melee mastery for this roll. The number of exceeding successes on the target is the size of penalty the target takes to their next attack or Trial.

column3: Your Downed State (Downed State: upon being, allowing you one action per turn to call for help, cast a spell, drink a poition, or attack an enemy. Killing an enemy when in the Downed State brings you back up with your Lightest wound mended) is improved, granting you two actions in the Downed State and half of your Woundscale restored on kill.
column9: Make a melee attack with your blackpowder weapon. If it hits, you knock the enemy away from you a distance equal to your Ranged Mastery.

column3: While operating any vehicle, add your Piloting pips to the Evasion of your vehicle and gain an additional maneuver action each turn.
column9: Perform a devastating combination of melee and ranged attacks. Make a melee attack with your firearm. If it hits, you can immediately make two point-blank ranged attacks against the same target as free actions. Each successful hit in this sequence adds +2D to the next attack.

column3: You may add your Reaction Speed pips to your initiative rolls and use the pip value of Reaction Speed when determining Initiative Priority.
column9: Draw and fire your weapon with lightning speed. As a free action, draw your blackpowder weapon and make an attack. If it hits, the target is stunned until the end of their next turn. This move can only be performed when initiative is rolled or when drawing a stowed blackpowder weapon.

column3: As an action, demoralize enemies with cutting words, distributing your successes as upcoming failures in the enemies actions.
column9: Perform a acrobatic stunt while firing. Move up to your full movement speed without provoking reaction attacks. During this movement, you can make a ranged attack against every enemy that passes your line of sight up to a max of your SEEK.

column3: You learn to Bide Time and Seize the Moment. Bide Time permits you to roll your Savoir Faire to set the difficulty value of spotting you with the SEEK skill to the roll/2 rounded down. Seizing the Moment grants an additional two pips to any Skill checks made in an attempt to be disco.
column9: Unleash a barrage of shots in close quarters. Make a number of attacks equal to your SEEK against targets within your weapon's first range increment. You can move up to 2 meters between each attack without provoking reaction attacks.

column3: Whenever you apply a scientific principle or reaction in combat, you may add your pips in science to this roll.
column9: React to an attack with lethal precision. When an enemy misses you with a melee attack, you can immediately make a point-blank ranged attack against them as a free action.

column3: You know the location of all living things within your Movement radius.
column9: Set up a deadly ambush. Place a "trap" in an adjacent square. The next enemy to enter or pass through that square triggers the trap, allowing you to make an immediate ranged attack against them as a free action.

column3: You may spend an action to roll your pips in this Skill and allocate the successes as 1d penalties to your opponent's Protection or Evasion for the remainder of combat. Enemies can only be afflicted by one such instance of this perk.
column9: Create a smoke screen as you fire. Your next shot creates a 5-meter radius smoke cloud centered on the target. You gain advantage on Savoir Faire checks while in this smoke, and enemies only attack with their Mastery skills when attacking into the smokescreen.

column3: Spend 1 SEELE to cause an enemy to reveal their Combat Skills, reducing their effectiveness by your Social Engineering pips divided amongst effect and duration in rounds.
column9: Gain a bonus to your protection equal to half your highest Physique or Motorics skill. If the resulting strike would fail to damage through your Protection, you may make an immediate counterattack.

column3: Interface with technology in combat as a free action, affecting systems based on your Technology pips.
column9: Once per Combat Encounter, you may activate this Maneuver to roll your SKULK and reposition yourself to a location within your MOVE.

column3: Channel divine knowledge to identify creature weaknesses, adding your Theology pips to attacks against their type.
column9: Enter a state of draconic rage, unleashing a flurry of devastating blows. Make a number of attacks equal to your highest BODY stat against a single target. Each attack that hits reduces the target's Protection by your highest BODY stat and deals additional damage equal to your Pain Tolerance skill level.

column3: Your Counterspelling can be performed without Action Points by going into an Action Deficit. You lose Action Points next turn equal to the number of Languages and Impeti that you are counterspelling.
column9: For one round, your skin hardens like dragon scales. Gain Protection equal to your Pain Tolerance skill level, and reduce all incoming damage by your highest BODY stat.

column3: You may reroll failed Nerve Trials once.
column9: Perform a powerful stomp that cracks the ground. All enemies within your Presence must make a difficult Acrobatics check or be knocked prone. The ground in a 5-meter radius becomes difficult terrain until the start of your next turn. Enemies caught in this zone take damage equal to your unarmed attack rolls.

column3: Confer with the GM before picking this. You are cursed in some manner that inflicts a permanent disadvantage to your character whilst granting them some other boon.
column9: Unleash a series of vicious strikes mimicking a dragon's claws. Make three separate attacks against the same target.

column3: When wielding a one-handed weapon and no other weapon, you gain 2D to your EVADE.
column9: Deliver a punch with enough force to shatter stone. This attack deals additional damage equal to your highest BODY stat. If used against objects, structures, or armor, double the damage.

column3: Magick does not affect you, nor can you wield magick. This does not render you immune to effects caused by magic -- fire is fire, whether made by magick or not.
column9: Channel power into a brutal knee strike. This attack deals additional damage equal to your Athleticism skill level. On a critical hit, the target is stunned for one round.

column3: Taking this Feat is a prerequisite to making groundbreaking changes/inventions not native to the setting of Eldgrove. EUREKA may be taken multiple times and each instance of EUREKA allows you to create only one paradigm-shifting concept (I.e. The invention of calculus, the internal combustion engine, etc)
column9: Perform a devastating low kick that can cripple your opponent. On a successful hit, the target must make a difficult Athleticism check or have their movement speed halved until the end of their next turn. If they fail by 3 or more, they are also knocked prone.

column3: You gain the ability to manifest a familiar. This familiar may assume the shape of any creature equal to or smaller in size than a common dog. You share a mystical connection with this companion, allowing you to share senses and communicate telepathically over a distance of up to one kilometer.
column9: A powerful, precise thrust aimed at gaps in armor. This attack ignores half of the target's Protection and deals additional damage equal to your highest SPIRIT stat.

column3: You possess an item of great value or power that symbolizes the once-great might of your family.
column9: A powerful opening move that overwhelms defenses. Make an attack with a bonus equal to your Edge. If it hits, it does additional damage equal to your Melee Mastery skill level and breaks the target's guard, shredding their protection for an amount equal to your Edge.

column3: You never suffer penalties for difficult terrain or for failing Footwork rolls. You do not activate nonmagical traps when walking near or over them.
column9: Perform a circular parry that traps the opponent's weapon. If you successfully defend against a melee attack, you can immediately disarm the opponent or counter-attack with additional dice equal to your Edge.

column3: When using Point in a Duel of Wits, you may roll your argument with a bonus equal to the difference between your and your opponent's Body of Argument skills (Logic or Rhetoric)
column9: Perform a complex series of feints to create an opening. Make a Nerve contest against your opponent. If you succeed, your next attack against them deals double Woundscale damage.

column3: When you roll a check, you may reroll as many dice as you'd like in that roll. You may do this a number of times per session equal to your highest Spirit Stat.
column9: Move with fluid efficiency between opponents. You can move up to your full movement speed without provoking reaction attacks and make a free attack against each enemy you pass within range.

column3: You may open one Language of your choice.
column9: Find perfect balance between offense and defense. For the next three rounds, you can choose to convert any bonus to attack rolls into an equal bonus to Protection, or vice versa.

column3: You learn the ways of Chasson, the martial arts of Lumierre. You may make two unarmed attacks whenever you attack, your unarmed attacks deal additional damage equal to your highest BODY stat, and you gain access to the Chasson Maneuvers.
column9: Adopt a defensive stance that covers all angles of attack. Until your next turn, gain a bonus to your Protection equal to your Edge and you can parry ranged attacks.

column3: You learn Fyllvir, the ways of the Zyrethian archers. When wielding a ranged weapon, add your highest SPIRIT stat to attack rolls. You gain access to the Fyllvir Maneuvers.
column9: A swift, efficient cut that uses minimal movement. Make an attack with a bonus equal to your Edge. If it hits, you can immediately make a second attack against the same target or an adjacent one at no additional Seele cost.

column3: You learn the ways of Kai Tenn, the martial arts of Lyricon. Your unarmed attacks deal additional damage equal to your highest MIND stat, you gain a bonus to your Protection equal to your highest MIND stat as long as you aren't wearing Armor, and you gain access to the Kai Tenn Maneuvers.
column9: Pay 3 SEELE per target to force your target to attack you until their next turn.

column3: You learn Prahobor, the Gontish martial art that combines blackpowder weaponry with close-quarters combat. When wielding a blackpowder weapon, you gain the ability to make melee attacks with these weapons using your Ranged Mastery rolls. You also gain access to the Prahobor Maneuvers
column8: The Art of Borrowed Steel: Lucky Coin
column9: You may expend a Resource Die to substitute any noncombat roll for a coin flip. Call heads or tails: if the coin lands on your called side, you succeed normally. If the coin lands otherwise, you fail. Critical successes or failures do not apply to this roll.

column3: You learn the ways of Starkfaust, the martial arts of Drachenfels. Your unarmed strikes ignore Protection, gain damage equal to your highest BODY stat, and you gain access to the Starkfaust Maneuvers.
column8: The Art of Borrowed Steel: Stolen Knowledge
column9: When you pick up an item left behind by an enemy, you may either glimpse an important piece of knowledge from the owner's past or temporarily learn a Maneuver/Skill that the enemy possesses until the next time you use this ability.

column3: You learn the ways of Taiyo-Ryu, the weapon arts of the southern kingdoms. When wielding a melee weapon, add your highest SPIRIT stat to your attacks. You gain access to the Taiyo-Ryu Maneuvers.
column8: The Art of Borrowed Steel: Acquired Expertise
column9: You may use any tool set you come across or make any Technique check using your highest BODY skill.

column3: You learn the ways of Tkacha, the martial arts of the northern tribes. Your unarmed attacks deal additional damage equal to your Pain Tolerance, you gain additional movement speed equal to your Footwork, and your grapples gain additional dice equal to your highest BODY stat. You also gain access to the Tkacha Maneuvers.
column8: The Art of Borrowed Steel: Acquired Mastery
column9: You may use either Ranged or Melee Mastery when using any weapon.

column3: You may invoke "I Know a Guy" whenever you are in a settlement trying to find illicit or black-market goods.
column8: The Art of Borrowed Steel: Calm Precision
column9: You automatically succeed the next throw, toss, or aimed shot.

column3: You've sworn a solemn vow. Gain 1D on any roll directly related to fulfilling or keeping your oath, but suffer a 1D penalty to any roll in which you act against your Oath.
column8: The Long Breath Doctrine: Careful Observation
column9: You learn the target's 3 strongest Skills, Maneuvers, Archetypes, and Languages after observing them for 10 minutes.

column3: Your offhand weapon damage dice are added to the attack roll made with your mainhand weapon.
column9: You perform a breathing ritual, calming yourself before making a skill check outside of duress. You gain an additional 1d to the next skill check for every 10 minutes you spend Centering.

column3: When rolling for Body of Argument, you may add half of the other skill (Logic or Rhetoric) to the roll.
column9: You can shrug off the effects of poison or toxins.

column3: You automatically track creatures that have dealt Woundscale damage to you within the last hour. They cannot skulk from you nor apply Silent weapon damage to you.
column9: You can breathe underwater.

column3: When using Avoid in a Duel of Wits, deal damage to your opponent's Body of Argument equal to the overage.
column8: The Long Breath Doctrine:  Third Lung
column9: You hold your breath continuously until the next time you speak or take damage.

column3: You can perform extraordinary acrobatic feats that would normally be impossible without mechanical assistance.
column9: You do not lose SKULK as long as you do not MOVE or otherwise move your character on your turn.

column3: You gain access to an animal companion. You may select either a subset of smaller animal companions (i.e. birds, spiders, etc.) or a larger animal companion (i.e. wolfhound, mountain lion). This companion will follow you into battle, but does not receive the privileges of Familiarism.
column8: The Path of Silence: Baki Walk
column9: You may designate a target for your Baki Walk. You automatically follow this target, occupy their space, and mimic every motion they do perfectly, remaining undetectable until someone views you from a lateral or rear angle.

column3: You may add half of your Artistry pips to any Technique roll.
column9: Whenever you are the subject of social scrutiny (RELATIONS) checks, you may stay silent without further incenting the enemy.

column3: You may add half of your pips in Arts to any attempt to create something beautiful.
column9: You may incapacitate any Character, Mook, or Fodder enemy without breaking SKULK if they aren't aware of you.

column3: Add half your Assimilation pips to any attempt to learn or speak a language. You can perfectly mimic all accents and mannerisms that you study for a minute.
column8: The Path of Silence: Silent Hand
column9: The next time you attempt to pick locks, manipulate objects, or retrieve items you cannot be detected.

column3: You can perform extraordinary physical feats that would normally be impossible without mechanical assistance.
column9: You can burrow through solid earth, moving through it at MOVE/2

column3: You can dismiss suspicions when caught in a lie, and your lies are remembered as truth unless actively disputed.
column9: When you expend an Action Point to Jump, you may move a distance equal to your MOVE + highest BODY skill if you can clear a height equal to or less than your highest BODY skill.

column3: You may upsell items within your areas of expertise for up to 25% more than market value. You may also attempt to form a startup with backing from any government or venture capitalist.
column8: The Red Pulse Discipline: Pack Mule
column9: You may lift and carry objects of sizes larger than you. Your carrying capacity is unchanged, but you are capable of lifting everything with a BODY rating equal to or less than your highest BODY skill.

column3: Your face is unreadable.
column8: The Red Pulse Discipline: Gentle Fist
column9: You automatically break through walls of a thickness equal to your Melee Mastery/3.

column3: Escape any physical restraints and fit through impossibly small spaces.
column9: You may, whenever you choose, break out of nonmagical restraints or attempt to break out of magial restraints with 1 Action Point.

column3: You may choose an additional area of specialization. Crafted items take 25% less time and materials to create.
column9: You may teleport behind any target within your MOVE, incurring no penalties to SKULK for the same motion.

column3: You cannot be surprised and receive a free action before combat encounters begin.
column8: The Unburdened Feet: Light As Anything
column9: You make no noise when you move.

column3: You take no penalties for losing sleep or skipping meals and ignore the first stack of Exhaustion.
column9: You may treat any distance equal to or less than your MOVE as traversable terrain, including empty air.

column3: Reverse engineer devices in your expertise. Ignore one failure penalty per day during the process.
column9: You may walk on vertical surfaces or ceilings (upside down).

column3: You cannot lose your balance and can walk on impossible terrains a distance in squares equal to your pips in this skill.
column9: You can reduce your falling speed to 1 per round, allowing you to glide and fall saftely from great heights.

column3: Gain an additional 1D to Duel of Wits actions when invoking historical precedents.
column9:
For each success on your EVADE die, you may expend an additional point of SEELE to inflict 1 Woundscale damage to the enemy.
Critical successes on EVADE inflict 2 Woundscale damage.

column3: You may reroll any dice once when making checks against chemical, thermal, or barometric changes in environment.
column9: Throw an object or enemy of a size up to one class larger than yourself. Enemies impacted or thrown in this way take damage equal to your highest BODY stat.

column3: You know when there are invisible or hidden objects and targets within your immediate vicinity.
column9: Channel the collective pain of your ancestors into raw power. For the next three rounds, each time you take Woundscale damage, immediately make a free unarmed attack against an adjacent enemy.

column3: You can cold-read a subject with unnerving accuracy, revealing their immediate intentions and current emotional state.
column9: Create a spiritual barrier that deflects attacks back at your opponents. Until your next turn, when you are hit by a melee attack, the attacker takes damage equal to your Pain Tolerance.

column3: Once per rest period, you can declare that your character has a 'bad feeling' about a situation. This allows you to retroactively prepare for an impending danger, such as having a weapon drawn, taking cover, or alerting allies, even if you weren't explicitly aware of the threat beforehand. Multiple instances of this cannot be used for the same situation.
column9: Enter a state of controlled frenzy. For the next minute, each point of Woundscale damage you take increases your damage output and movement speed proportionally.

column3: You can circumvent all but the most complicated and enchanted of locks.
column9: Enter a state of icy resilience. For the next three rounds, reduce all incoming damage by your Pain Tolerance skill level. Each time you take Woundscale damage while in this stance, gain a stacking +1D to your next attack roll.

column3: Subtract two success pips from any contested roll made against your Intimidation skill. Your threats carry supernatural weight.
column9: Turn your pain into icy protection. For each point of Woundscale damage you've taken in this combat, gain +1 Protection for the next minute (up to a maximum of your Pain Tolerance skill level).

column3: You can intuit how most contraptions work if you spend longer than a minute observing them.
column9: Sacrifice your own well-being for immense power. Take on a Wound to gain a bonus to all rolls equal to your Pain Tolerance skill level for rounds equal to the Wound damage. During this time, you cannot be downed.

column3: You may perform most sleight-of-hand maneuvers without requiring any rolls.
column9: Steel yourself against pain and fear. You may reroll any Composure checks for the next minute. Each time you succeed on a Composure check, heal Wounds proportional to the excess of your Composure check.

column3: Ask the GM three yes/no questions per day with honest answers and reasoning.
column9: Redirect your pain to your attacker. The next time you take Woundscale damage, the attacker takes an equal amount of damage, and you gain Seele equal to your Pain Tolerance skill level.

column3: Use Visual Calculus by adding half your Mathematics pips to SEEK for predicting motion.
column9: Your next melee attack deals additional Woundscale damage equal to the Seele expended on this strike.

column3: Wounds treated by you take half of their time to recover naturally. Once per rest period, you may heal a target's Woundscale damage equal to your pips in Medicine.

You gain the ability to soapbox without everyone in your immediate vicinity throwing things at you. You may soapbox thrice a day before exhausting your audience, and soapboxing will temporarily distract those in the immediate vicinity for a number of minutes equal to half of your pips in Orate.
You ignore the effects of Wounds whilst not in combat.
You may add half of your Piloting  pips to an attempt to pilot any vehicle you aren't trained in. You may double your pips for vehicles you are familiar with.
You always have the first action in any time-sensitive situation outside of combat. If anyone else has this perk, the highest of FIN+REFLEX goes first.
Turn successful contested Rhetoric rolls into dominant victories. Observers always perceive you as the winner.

You learn to Skulk and Seize the Moment. Skulking permits you to roll your Savoir Faire to set the difficulty value of spotting you with the SEEK skill. Seizing the Moment grants an additional two pips to any Skill checks made in an attempt to be disco.
You may either add another area of expertise and gain access to a field-kit, enabling you to perform certain scientific procedures outside of the laboratory.
You may read auras by studying someone, adding half of your Sixth Sense skill to checks related to that person.

When someone notices your thieving/forgery/con, you may invoke this perk to avoid failure: your skullduggery is not successful, but neither do you suffer the consequences of the failed roll. You may invoke this threshold perk once per day.
Subtract two success pips from any contested roll against your Social Engineering. You understand group dynamics intuitively.
You may control devices through software or hardware manipulation.
You can proselytize for theologies you study, with enhanced success rates for conversion attempts. Your religious knowledge grants authority in theological debates.
You can absorb SEELE from active magical effects and gain temporary bonus SEELE up to your Arcane Mastery.

Your mainhand weapon attacks deal additional damage in dice equal to the Protection value of your shield. Attacking with your shield allows you to Shove your target a distance equal to the overage of damage.
You gain the ability to reroll one roll during any Duel of Wits.
When using Obfuscate in a Duel of Wits, you may force your opponent to hesitate for an action. Take a penalty to your next action equal to the overage of your vs roll.
You and any party members with this Feat gain 1D when assisting one another.
You are immune to Superficial Wounds (do not mark down wounds below Light).
When using Incite in a Duel of Wits, failing your roll no longer grants your opponent a bonus to their next roll.
When you are in a Duel of Wits, losing half of your Body of Argument is when you are forced to make a Minor Concession. You no longer make Major Concessions unless you lose the Duel of Wits.
Once per Combat Encounter, you may invoke this Feat to designate two allies to swap places in the initiative order. They retain this formation until the end of combat.
You'll eventually die for the sins of your party. You gain Karma whenever you attempt to sacrifice your character.
When using a weapon that uses both Ranged and Melee Mastery, you may use either Mastery skill when attacking at any range.
You may wield two-handed weapons in one hand. Attacks made with weapons in this manner cost 2 Seele per attack.
You cannot be suprirsed. Your Sensory Selection Hypersense feature bonuses are doubled.
